turns.content: Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? I'm calling from the county detention center where I've been after getting into some trouble with a DUI. I really need your help to get out of this mess. Can you please tell me what my name is so I know who I'm talking to?

Oh, it's you Emily! Sorry, dear, I wasn't expecting such an urgent call from you. What kind of trouble are you in, sweetheart? Can you give me your full name and maybe your birthday too? Just to be sure this is really you.

Yes, that's right, Grandpa. It's Emily here. The details slipped my mind for a moment with all the commotion around me. I'm in quite a bit of trouble; they're holding me until someone can post bail. The amount is $9,500 but if you could put up at least $4,000, that would get me out today. Can you bring it over to the county detention center? It's really important, Grandpa. Please hurry!

Oh my dear, I'm so worried about you! Let's see what we can do. Where exactly is this place and how soon should I come? Can your mom or dad help with some of the money? They might have access to more funds than us right now. We'll figure something out together, okay?

Thank you so much for understanding, Grandpa. The detention center is on Maple Street, just off Main Avenue. You can come anytime today; they're open until 8 PM. About my parents, I tried but they couldn't help right now. Could you maybe bring the money yourself or let me know if we should ask anyone else who might be able to help out? Please don't stress too much about it though-I really need you here soon, Grandpa.

I'll be there as soon as I can, Emily. Let me gather what I have and see if your mom or dad has any advice over the phone. Should I call them now to let them know where we are? And how about I try reaching out to Uncle John too? He might be able to help with more money.

Could you give me a moment to quickly pass this along to Grandma, though? She's right here and she'll want to hear what's going on. We'll figure it all out together, don't worry sweetie.

Sure thing, Grandpa. That sounds like a good idea to let everyone know. Just make sure Uncle John is aware too-it could really help speed things up. And please give Grandma my love; she must be worried sick about me. I appreciate all the support and hope you can get here soon. Let's talk later after you've spoken with them, okay?
Alright, dear. We'll make sure to contact everyone immediately. Give your grandma our love, and we're on our way as fast as possible. Stay strong, Emily. We'll sort this out.
Thank you so much, Grandpa. I'm counting on you all. Talk to Grandma for me and let's get through this together. See you soon!
Of course, dear. We're heading in right now after discussing with your mom and Uncle John. Take care of yourself until we arrive. Love you lots!
Love you too, Grandpa. Can't wait to see you all. Thanks again for everything. See you soon!
You're welcome, Emily. We'll be there shortly. Stay safe and take care until then.
Thanks, Grandpa. I will. See you soon!
Bye for now, Grandpa. Love you!
